| Purpose                                 | Plain-English Definition                                                   | Usage Notes                                                                                         | Example SQL Queries                                                                                            |
-------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Ledger line identification             | A unique identifier for each ledger line in the financial ledger.                        | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE ledger_line_id = 123;\
|
| Ledger account identification           | A unique identifier for each ledger account in the financial ledger.                       | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE account_id = 456;\
|
| Transaction identification              | A unique identifier for each transaction in the financial ledger.                          | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE transaction_id = 789;\
|
| Entry date identification              | The date when the entry was made in the financial ledger.                                   | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE entry_date = '2022-01-01';\
|
| Amount identification                 | The total value of the transaction in the financial ledger.                                | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE amount = 1000;\
|
| Governance score (0-100)              | A governance score indicating the quality of data in the financial ledger.                    | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE governanceScore = 80;\
|
| Has column                             | Indicates if a column has been enriched with additional information.                         | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE hasColumn = true;\
|
| Documents                             | Links business terms/metrics to the assets they define.                                   | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE documents = 'yes';\
|
| Has provider transaction              | Indicates if a transaction has been provided by an external source.                         | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE hasProviderTransaction = true;\
|
| Has auth session                      | Indicates if a transaction has been authenticated by an external source.                     | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE hasAuthSession = true;\
|
| Usage recommendation                 | Indicates if a transaction requires additional review or usage guidance.                    | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE usagerecommendation = true;\
|
| Belongs to table                      | Indicates if a row belongs to a specific table.                                           | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE belongstotable = true;\
|
| Enriches                              | Indicates if the row has been enriched with additional information.                          | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE enriches = true;\
|
| Inferred datatype                   | The data type inferred from the entry date.                                            | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE inferredDatatype = 'date';\
|
| Affects ledger account               | Indicates if a row affects the ledger account balance.                                   | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE affectsLedgerAccount = true;\
|
| Documents                             | Links business terms/metrics to the assets they define.                                   | Must be used to link related records, not unique across all tables.                                 | \
	SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_lines_enriched_v1 \nWHERE documents = 'yes';\
|
# No delta required

Table Purpose/Context: The foundation_financial.deposits_v4 table contains information about deposits made to a financial institution.

Plain-English Definitions:
* deposit_id: Unique identifier for the deposit
* user_id: Identifier for the user who made the deposit
* amount: Amount of money deposited
* method: Method used to make the deposit
* deposit_date: Date the deposit was made

Usage Notes:
* Grains: Each row represents a single deposit
* Joins/Keys: The table can be joined with other tables on user_id and deposit_date
* Caveats: There may be some missing data for certain columns, especially amount and method

Example SQL Queries:
SELECT * FROM foundation_financial.deposits_v4 WHERE deposit_date = '2022-01-01'
SELECT foundation_financial.deposits_v4.user_id, foundation_financial.deposits_v4.amount FROM foundation_financial.deposits_v4 GROUP BY user_id

| Purpose/Context | Definition | Usage Notes | Grains/Joins/Keys | Caveats |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Ledger Account Balances V1 | A ledger account balance record contains information about the current balance of a specific ledger account. | Used for tracking and reporting ledger account balances. Grain: individual ledger account balances. Join key: account_id, user_id. Caveat: does not include historical data. | Join with LedgerAccount to get detailed information about the ledger account.
| Ledger Account Balances V1 (Raw) | Raw ledger account balance data without any additional context or metadata. | Used for storing raw ledger account balance data. Grain: individual ledger account balances. Join key: account_id, user_id. Caveat: does not include any additional context or metadata. | 
| Usage Notes |
| The Ledger Account Balances V1 table provides a standardized way to store and report ledger account balances.
| This table can be used in conjunction with the LedgerAccount table to get more detailed information about each ledger account balance record.
| 
| SQL Queries |
| SELECT * FROM foundation.financial.ledger_account_balances_v1;
| SELECT account_id, user_id, balance FROM foundation.financial.ledger_account_balances_v1 WHERE as_of_date = '2022-01-01';
| 
| Delta Ontology TTL: []

governance_doc_markdown.table_purpose: This table stores raw data about financial transactions made through WorldPay.
governance_doc_markdown.table_context: Each row in this table represents a single transaction, including its unique identifier, type, amount, status, and user associated with the transaction.

columns.name: transaction_id
columns.plain_english_definition: A unique identifier for each financial transaction made through WorldPay.

columns.name: transaction_type
columns.plain_english_definition: The type of the financial transaction, such as donation or purchase.

columns.name: amount
columns.plain_english_definition: The monetary value of the financial transaction.

columns.name: status
columns.plain_english_definition: The current status of the financial transaction, such as pending or completed.

columns.name: user_id
columns.plain_english_definition: The unique identifier for the user who initiated the financial transaction.

governance_doc_markdown.purpose/context: Records when a new session is created for an account in the Authgateway.

plain_english_definitions.session_id: A unique identifier for the session.
plain_english_definitions.user_id: The ID of the user associated with the session.
plain_english_definitions.success: A boolean value indicating whether the session creation was successful or not.
plain_english_definitions.device_type: The type of device used to create the session (e.g., mobile, desktop).
plain_english_definitions.created_at: The date and time when the session was created.

governance_doc_markdown.usage_notes: Grain: individual session events. Joins/keys: join on user_id with user table, join on session_id with session table. Caveats: handle cases where device_type is missing or unknown.

example_sql_queries.sql: SELECT * FROM foundation.account.authgateway_session_created_events JOIN user ON user_id = user.id
SELECT * FROM foundation.account.authgateway_session_created_events WHERE created_at >= ? AND created_at <= ?
